sentence.Network_en: He was given a letter purportedly signed by the Prime Minister.
sentence.Network_cn: 他得到了一封据称有首相签名的信。

sentence.Network_en: This is purportedly the oldest tree in the world.
sentence.Network_cn: 据称这是世界上最古老的一棵树.

sentence.Network_en: Mayor Oh Se - Hoon launched the campaign last year, purportedly to improve efficiency.
sentence.Network_cn: 据悉,首尔市市长吴世勋于去年提出了这项旨在提高工作效率的计划.

PerfectNetExp.abs: OG上的SAT填空题 - 小马过河 ... embellish 修饰 purportedly 据称 humanitarian 人道主义者.

list.abs: Recursion relies on a " virtual stack " that purportedly has no real memory constraints ., 递回依赖于 " 虚拟堆叠 " 这看来已没有真正的记忆体限制.

entry.def: If you say that something has purportedly been done, you mean that you think that it has been done but you cannot be sure.

example.ex: He was given a letter purportedly signed by the Prime Minister.
example.tran: 他得到了一封据称有首相签名的信。

means.word_mean: 1. believed or reputed to be the case

auth_sentence.content: The Guatemalan government purportedly covered up its own corruption.
auth_sentence.res_content: The Guatemalan government purportedly covered up its own corruption.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The Guatemalan government purportedly covered up its own corruption.

auth_sentence.content: In Istanbul, the Iranians purportedly begged for sanctions relief.
auth_sentence.res_content: In Istanbul, the Iranians purportedly begged for sanctions relief.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: In Istanbul, the Iranians purportedly begged for sanctions relief.

auth_sentence.content: "I have plenty of clever generals," Napoleon purportedly said.
auth_sentence.res_content: "I have plenty of clever generals," Napoleon purportedly said.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: "I have plenty of clever generals," Napoleon purportedly said.
